ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A better grasp of the basics of Chinese language--writing, reading, speaking, and listening.
I improved on my language speaking and conversational skills

You really, really learn Chinese well, and the teachers care about you a lot. I went from not being able to speak to having conversations with parents and relatives. More than this, I think my teacher cultivated my interest in Chinese and my growth as a foreign language speaker.
How to read and write Chinese characters, speak and listen to the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is very intense and every day which is a strength. It could be improved by doing more drills with the teacher on how to say something. Class size is also a strength.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Take Chinese! It's a really fun way to learn a useful language.
Yes. This course has somewhat defined my experience at Yale, and I made a lot of friends by going through it. The workload is intense, but overall conducive to learning.
